english: wheat; cereal grains; barley (as in 大麦); malt

etymology.description: semantic: 夊 (‘slow step’) + phonetic: 來; 來 was originally used for ‘wheat’.
etymology.interpretation: Meaning is anchored by a ‘slow step/footprint’ semantic hint that evokes reaping or drooping stalks, while 來 supplies the sound. In early usage, 來 itself denoted ‘wheat’, which explains the tight semantic link that later specialized into 麥/麦.
etymology.simplification: Simplified from 麥 by streamlining the phonetic 來 and altering its 八 component to a single horizontal stroke (per Wiktionary), reducing strokes and compressing the original phono-semantic layout into 麦.

examples.chinese: 我家种了很多小麦(我家種了很多小麥)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jiā zhòng le hěn duō xiǎomài.
examples.english: My family planted a lot of wheat.

examples.chinese: 啤酒的麦芽很香(啤酒的麥芽很香)。
examples.english: The malt in the beer smells fragrant.

examples.chinese: 大麦和小麦都是重要的粮食作物(大麥和小麥都是重要的糧食作物)。
examples.pinyin: Dàmài hé xiǎomài dōu shì zhòngyào de liángshí zuòwù.
examples.english: Barley and wheat are both important food crops.
